page.title: 02Refuse Collection Enfield
page.content: For years refuse had been collected in metal dustbins. Recently a new system has been introduced. Refuse is now put in plastic sacks & placed at the property boundary. Exempted are the old & disabled, their rubbish is collected as usual. Objections are: residents do the dustmens' job; sacks are an eyesore & cause obstructions; sacks are too flimsy & animals can rip them open spilling rubbish. They also say they were not consulted. The council says it has saved Â£430,000 p.a. with this system. It only takes 2 minutes a week to put out sacks. Sacks are strong enough. Not as much rubbish is spilled. The decision was taken at an Open Meeting which was not well attended. In a survey of 150 people, 50% liked the new scheme and 50% did not.
